question.body: How is the heart contraction typically initiated?

multiple_choice.choice: Through voluntary control from the brain
Through electrical control within the heart
From specialized skeletal muscles in the region

response.feedback: Incorrect. Control of heart function is not voluntary.
Incorrect. There are some reflexes that will change heart rate, but they do not directly stimulate contraction.
Correct. Pacemaker cells in the heart stimulate electrical contraction; if these cells fail, an artificial "pacemaker" can be used to generate the stimulus for the heart.
Incorrect. Skeletal muscles and cardiac muscle donâ€™t interact.

part.hint: It is a localized (or "self-") electrical charge.
